messages.text:
This may sound odd, but I just uninstalled Docker Desktop, and I’d like to still build Dockerfiles..
I thought I’d use hyperkit, minikube, and helm, all of which I installed from Homebrew.

elements.text:
This may sound odd, but I just uninstalled Docker Desktop, and I’d like to still build Dockerfiles..
I thought I’d use hyperkit, minikube, and helm, all of which I installed from Homebrew.

messages.text: Maybe this is not the way it’s supposed to work. :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: Maybe this is not the way it’s supposed to work.

messages.text: I might have to uninstall hyperkit, and re-install docker desktop. Hmm.

elements.text: I might have to uninstall hyperkit, and re-install docker desktop. Hmm.

messages.text: Right now K8s on my Mac is only using 50% CPU (of one core). When I enabled it via the checkbox in Docker desktop, it used 100%. (It’s not ‘doing’ anything, it’s just existing.)

elements.text: Right now K8s on my Mac is only using 50% CPU (of one core). When I enabled it via the checkbox in Docker desktop, it used 100%. (It’s not ‘doing’ anything, it’s just existing.)

messages.text: MiniConda works fine with Docker Desktop! :+1:

elements.text: MiniConda works fine with Docker Desktop!

messages.text: I'm just kicking off a small project and was hoping to find a base image that would let me get going quickly. Can anyone recommend a development image, perhaps something like vscode web + julia, jupyter + julia or pluto.jl + julia? Coming from the R world, I'm looking for something similar to the RStudio images that include a webserver IDE and runtime. Tried doing some quick searching on dockerhub and wasn't turning anything up.

elements.text: I'm just kicking off a small project and was hoping to find a base image that would let me get going quickly. Can anyone recommend a development image, perhaps something like vscode web + julia, jupyter + julia or pluto.jl + julia? Coming from the R world, I'm looking for something similar to the RStudio images that include a webserver IDE and runtime. Tried doing some quick searching on dockerhub and wasn't turning anything up.

messages.text:
Try my image! It has JupyterLab and Pluto.

<https://hub.docker.com/repository/docker/statisticalmice/julia-jupyter|https://hub.docker.com/repository/docker/statisticalmice/julia-jupyter>

elements.text: Try my image! It has JupyterLab and Pluto.

messages.text:
Thanks <@U01CQTKB86N> this looks perfect! Almost embarrassed that I didn't find it already, but searching for "julia jupter" seems to prioritize org names over image names... not impressed with the docker hub search.

Nevertheless this looks great - amazing docs also!

elements.text:

messages.text: I have experimented with some other combinations of features, but they don’t seem that useful.

elements.text: I have experimented with some other combinations of features, but they don’t seem that useful.

messages.text: Another image that’s based on the 1.6 that would do PackageCompiler would be nice, but I didn’t want to spend the time on understanding its use.
